definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Full Moon is approaching and she has to find a cure or never return.
sentences.chinese: 滿月將至，她要麼找到解決的辦法，要麼將一去不回。

sentences.english: Soon I shall find, in passing on, time gone.
sentences.chinese: 很快，我發現，在生長和衰退中，時間一去不回。

sentences.english: They are like in the sky kite, broken line, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他們就像放在天空的風箏，斷了線，一去不回。

sentences.english: One's life, I always after the tide, and then back.
sentences.chinese: 人的一生總是先盛後衰，然後一去不回。

sentences.english: The boy never came back after he picked the apples.
sentences.chinese: 後，男孩一去不回選蘋果。

sentences.english: Now, Henge has passed away for many years, youth of our generation had gone and was unable to return back.
sentences.chinese: 而今，痕戈已經辭世多年，青春也已一去不回。

definition: see 杳無音信|杳无音信[yao3 wu2 yin1 xin4]
to receive no news whatsoever about sb
to go far/to escape to faraway places
to be gone forever (idiom)/to disappear without a trace
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to leave home/to go off/to run away
